c647d7a4-c1ab-4fc7-acb2-7eba04398896.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that examines the complexity of physiological functions and the pathophysiological responses to altered health conditions of individuals across the lifespan. In doing so, the badge earner explored the impact of the disease process at the molecular, cellular, organ, and body-system level in relation to how it impacts the process of alteration, adaptation, and regulatory function of the body.
c647d7a4-c1ab-4fc7-acb2-7eba04398896.name: Advanced Pathophysiology

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN's Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate knowledge of normal anatomy and physiology and pathological physiological mechanisms.
Compare and contrast pathophysiological changes that occur across the lifespan.
Explore the etiology, epidemiology, pathophysiology, and laboratory differences of disease process that impact health.
Apply current evidenced-based practice and treatment standards to pathological disease conditions.
Evaluate data related to common disease processes and conditions to determine appropriate nursing interventions.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments, and assessments associated with N512 – Advanced Pathophysiology (3 credits).

d8f5db1d-35fb-4323-89a7-0855882dbddd.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that uses a comprehensive health promotion, disease prevention, and health restoration model to focus on the culturally competent, advanced comprehensive assessment of clients across the lifespan, including effective data collection and documentation.
d8f5db1d-35fb-4323-89a7-0855882dbddd.name: Advanced Physical Assessment

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN's Elements of Master's Education in Nursing
QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Evaluate the role of the graduate level nurse to integrate knowledge of anatomy and pathophysiology when interpreting assessment and diagnostic data in individuals, families, and populations by performing comprehensive health assessment.

Synthesize the elements of a culturally sensitive, developmentally appropriate and comprehensive health history to implement comprehensive assessment methods that focus on a holistic view of the patient.

Perform a systematic advanced physical assessment on patients across the life span to differentiate between normal and abnormal findings and formulate sound diagnostic reasoning and clinical judgment.
Apply the process of collecting and analyzing patient data and correlating it with evidence-based data for clinical reasoning.
Assess the bio-psychosocial, cultural, spiritual, and environmental elements that may affect health.
Develop nursing care approaches through the process of comprehensive health assessment which promote health, reduce health risks, empower preventive health behaviors, and restore health.

Effectively utilize health informatics technologies to retrieve data, improve decision making, and evaluate evidence to prevent or treat illness, perform patient education , and formulate an adaptive needs list in advanced health assessment with diverse clients and populations.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments, and assessments associated with N522PE – Advanced Physical Assessment (3 credits).

cdf3b175-6f7e-4e57-bc64-b1960fab3058.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that focuses on the theoretical background and principles of the pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and pharmacotherapeutics of drugs and natural products commonly used in the advanced practice nurse’s management of acute and chronic illnesses. In doing so, the badge earner has learned to employ therapeutic decision-making in drug selection and evaluation in the course of patient care.
cdf3b175-6f7e-4e57-bc64-b1960fab3058.name: Advanced Pharmacology

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN's Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Examine advanced pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamics concepts as they relate to pathophysiologic changes in patients across the lifespan
Identify the fundamental principles of pharmacology related to prescribed drugs, over-the-counter drugs and natural products.
Discuss the mechanism of action of each major drug class and natural product at the molecular/cellular and organ/organ system level.
Evaluate common side effects and interactions associated with the major classes of drugs.
Utilize evidence-based advanced nursing and pharmacological interventions in select case studies to resolve complex and biological, psychological, physiological and pathophysiologic conditions.

Synthesize research and evidence of pharmacological concepts that guides clinical judgment to develop a therapeutic regimen that maximizes efficacy and maintains quality while minimizing adverse effects.
Differentiate between therapeutic and adverse effects of pharmacological interventions and inappropriate use patterns, such as polypharmacy and polysubstance abuse interactions.
Teach patients, family members, and others from diverse populations regarding safe and effective use of drugs and natural products.
Determine nursing prescriptive privileges, parameters and scope of practice, and restrictions as delineated in federal and state laws and regulations, including state nurse practice acts.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments and assessments associated with N521: Advanced Pharmacology (3 credits).

690b87c1-b059-417f-9b1a-19f7a094b962.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that prepares the learner to be an effective online nurse educator. In doing so, the badge earner has demonstrated an understanding of best practices in online pedagogy, applied educational theory to the online environment, and assessed the components of an online course.
690b87c1-b059-417f-9b1a-19f7a094b962.name: Online Teaching in Nursing Education

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN, The Essentials of Master's Education
QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge has successfully completed all learning activities, assignments, and assessments associated with N534PE - Distance Education (3 credits)

cac979c2-43b2-4d48-81bd-3588112f1ebc.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that explores the roles and responsibilities of the infection prevention and control professional. In doing so, the badge earner has performed a detailed risk assessment and developed infection control policies and procedures for dealing with internal infection and the influx of patients with communicable diseases.
cac979c2-43b2-4d48-81bd-3588112f1ebc.name: Infection Prevention and Control – Nursing Roles and Responsibilities

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN, The Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Develop infection control strategies, policies and procedures.
Assess isolation/barrier precautions, appropriate patient placement and transition, patient care environments and hazards, environmental inspections, and patient immunization programs.
Examine infection control implications of products and medical equipment.
Create an organizational plan to address the influx of patients with communicable diseases and emerging infectious diseases.
Determine how public health agencies and communities collaborate in response to biological agents.
Examine infection prevention and control evidence-based approaches for antimicrobial stewardship.
Successfully complete of all learning activities, assignments, and assessments associated with N570PE: Infection Prevention and Control (3 credits).

b12ca397-d016-4636-b5ad-db576e4ab951.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level course in Healthcare Financial Management. To pass this course, students must demonstrate competency in the most commonly-used tools, processes, and techniques employed by financial managers in a healthcare environment.
b12ca397-d016-4636-b5ad-db576e4ab951.name: Healthcare Financial Management

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

badge_template_activities.title: Relate the purpose of healthcare financial management to the purpose of the organization and the value of healthcare financial management to management functions.
Apply quality assessment to healthcare financial management, identify the key financial managers, and examine healthcare reform.
Explain major components of financial statements, principles in preparing good financial reports, and tax-exempt status.
Describe and examine methods of RVU, classifying cost, allocating cost, and assembling cost.
Analyze distinctions among HMO’s, PPO’s, Defined-Contribution Plans, Direct Contracting, Consumer-Driven Plans, and High-Deductible Plans.
Understand the history and cost methods of Medicare and Medicaid.
Identify and explain the importance of working capital, revenue cycle, strategic/operational planning, and budgeting.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments, and assessments required in the graduate-level course MBA530 – Health Care Financial Management (3 credits).

27c29400-eddb-46a1-9921-c6101187b9c7.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that focuses on the process of evidence-based nursing case management patient care. It examines the role of the case manager as patient advocate and the incorporation of evidence-based care. Topics include identification of patient care innovations, implementation of the care, data collection of patient outcomes, and evaluation of the outcomes for continued care or revised care.
27c29400-eddb-46a1-9921-c6101187b9c7.name: Case Management Practice

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
Graduate QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Examine the role of the case manager in a selected specialty-based practice/target population.
Apply current evidence-based nursing case management practices to an identified target population.
Assess the implications of electronic information systems upon the role of the nurse case manager.
Examine the legal issues related to nursing case management.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments, and assessments required for the graduate-level nursing course N543 – Case Management and Evidence-Based Practice (3 credits).

f20ce519-b6c1-475a-a1ff-b24ffcc8e385.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that examines the history and evolution of the case manager concept from the inception of this concept through current practice.
f20ce519-b6c1-475a-a1ff-b24ffcc8e385.name: Concepts of Case Management

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
Graduate QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Explore the roles of the nurse case manager in the contemporary health care structure and in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team.
Analyze the concepts of case management, health care insurance, Affordable Care Act, and other economic, political, cultural, legal, and ethical issues in case management.
Apply the concept of leadership in the utilization of the case management process from the perspective of an advance practice nurse.
Demonstrate knowledge of information technology and health care information systems in case management.
Apply insurance criteria to evaluate patient eligibility for services, for quality improvement and for safety in practice.
Initiate a patient centered case management plan using national standard of practice and evidence-based practice guidelines.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments and assessments required for the graduate-level nursing course N541 - Concepts of Case Management (3 credits).

e1d6bf21-48b6-464b-bfe5-1ef3afa3fb95.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that examines the case management and reimbursement process as it relates to various specialty areas of healthcare across the life span. Topics included quality improvement, patient outcomes and patient care plan development.
e1d6bf21-48b6-464b-bfe5-1ef3afa3fb95.name: Case Management Process

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
Graduate QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Evaluate the role of the advanced nurse case manager in reimbursement for patient care including the concepts of healthcare insurance, healthcare benefits and the various reimbursement systems.
Examine the case management process throughout the healthcare continuum.
Assess the discharge planning process as it relates to care management and levels of care.
Correlate the process of case management with positive and culturally sensitive patient outcomes.
Delineate the role of the advanced practice nurse in the case management process relating to quality improvement, leadership skills, interdisciplinary collaboration, and communication.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments and assessments required for the graduate-level nursing course N542 - Process of Case Management (3 credits).

ba6c5a55-3227-484c-8457-4071ae844633.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that examines the financial and ethical aspects of life care planning as it relates to disease management, coordination of care, and the process of identifying long-term care for vulnerable populations. It examines patients with congenital complications, chronic illness or complex injuries across the lifespan.
ba6c5a55-3227-484c-8457-4071ae844633.name: Life Care Planning

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
Graduate QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Assess the role of the nurse case manager in a specific specialty practice related to the life-care planning process.
Examine the individual needs and characteristics of an identified population in relation to the nurse case manager.
Investigate ethical, and financial issues related to life care planning.
Apply case management plans, critical pathways, evidence-based practice, and protocols in life care planning.
Develop a short term and long-term life care plan for a specific patient.
Coordinate case management protocols within an interdisciplinary care environment for an identified target population.
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments, and assessments required for the graduate-level nursing course N544PE – Life Care Planning (3 credits).

24aefa96-8847-49f7-8975-a95a9673f856.description: The holder of this badge has successfully completed a graduate-level nursing course that introduces the nurse practitioner student to diagnostic reasoning. In this course, previous pathophysiology, pharmacology and physical assessment knowledge is applied to simulated cases.
24aefa96-8847-49f7-8975-a95a9673f856.name: Diagnostic Reasoning for the APRN

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

alignments.name: AACN Essentials of Master's Education in Nursing
QSEN Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Define diagnostic reasoning and discuss the cause of diagnostic error
Generate hypotheses and create evidence-based testing strategies
Uncover basic abnormalities in laboratory, radiologic, and cardiologic studies and associate with appropriate differential diagnoses
Synthesize evidence to support interventions
Utilize informatics to access resources for clinical practice
Discuss opportunities to improve care for populations across the lifespan
Successfully complete all learning activities, assignments, and assessments associated with N523 – Diagnostic Reasoning for the APRN (3 credits).

8ed11cc3-191d-4d06-9d8d-f7251b0b9747.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed an Employers Council course that examines the challenge of promoting inclusion, diversity, and equity in the workplace.
8ed11cc3-191d-4d06-9d8d-f7251b0b9747.name: Social Justice

issuer.summary: issued by American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

entity.name: American Sentinel College of Nursing & Health Sciences at Post University

badge_template_activities.title: Define inclusion, diversity, and equity as they concern the workplace
Describe ways in which unconscious biases may prevent inclusion and can be sources for unintentional discrimination
Identify benefits of diversity in the workplace
Define transparency as it relates to equity
Describe the importance of equal access to opportunities
Identify solutions to help manage unconscious biases
Successfully complete the Employers Council course titled "Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity in the Workplace."
